results.question: Which scholars were born in Germany?
results.answer: Error executing graph query.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution)-[:IS_LOCATED_IN]->(city:City)
WHERE city.name =~ '.*Germany.*'
RETURN s.knownName AS scholar, 'Germany' AS birth_country, city.name AS birth_city

This version of the query correctly uses a regular expression with `ilike` (case-insensitive) to match any city containing the word 'Germany'. We assume '.*Germany.*' is a simplistic pattern and in practice, this may need further refinement. Additionally, our query structure now segregates matching scholars through their affiliations connected to cities in Germany. This approach respects the graph schema and avoids wildcards in relationships and proper usage of field names.

results.question: Which scholars won Nobel Prizes in Physics after 1990?
results.answer:
]
The scholars who won Nobel Prizes in Physics after 1990 are Andre Geim, Bertram N. Brockhouse, Clifford G. Shull, David J. Thouless, Jack Kilby, James Peebles, Klaus Hasselmann, Masatoshi Koshiba, Pierre-Gilles de Gennes, Andrea Ghez, David M. Lee, Hiroshi Amano, Konstantin Novoselov, Peter Higgs, Serge Haroche, Zhores Alferov, Albert Fert, Anton Zeilinger, Barry C. Barish, Daniel C. Tsui, David J. Wineland, Georges Charpak, G\u00e9rard Mourou, John L. Hall, Joseph H. Taylor Jr., Makoto Kobayashi, Rainer Weiss, Robert C. Richardson, Alain Aspect, Arthur B. McDonald, Carl Wieman, François Englert, George A. Akerlof, George F. Smoot, Giorgio Parisi, Herb Kroemer, Isamu Akasaki, John Clauser, Martinus J.G. Veltman, Robert B. Laughlin, Russell A. Hulse, Wolfgang Ketterle, Adam G. Riess, Anthony J. Leggett, Claude Cohen-Tannoudji, Doug Douglas M. Osheroff, Eric Cornell, J. Michael Kosterlitz, Roy J. Glauber, Steven Chu, Reinhard Genzel, Shuji Nakamura, Syukuro Manabe, William D. Phillips, Yoichiro Nambu.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics' AND p.awardYear > 1990
RETURN s.knownName AS scholar

results.question: Which scholars affiliated with an institution in Germany died between the years 1935 and 1945?
results.answer:
]
Walther Nernst, Hans Spemann, Richard Willstäetter, Carl Bosch, Hans Fischer, and Richard Willstätter are the scholars affiliated with institutions in Germany who died between the years 1935 and 1945. Walther Nernst died on November 18, 1941, at Berlin University. Hans Spemann passed away on September 12, 1941, at the University of Freiburg im Breisgau. Richard Willstätter's death dates are August 3, 1942, at both the Kaiser-Wilhelm-Institut (now Max-Planck Institut) für Chemie and the Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universit\u00e4t. Carl Bosch died on April 26, 1940, at the University of Heidelberg. Lastly, Hans Fischer died on March 31, 1945, at the Technische Hochschule (Institute of Technology).
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution)-[:IS_LOCATED_IN]->(c:City)-[:IS_CITY_IN]->(co:Country)
WHERE toLower(co.name) = 'germany' AND s.deathDate >= '1935-01-01' AND s.deathDate <= '1945-12-31'
RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName AS Scholarname, i.name AS InstitutionName, s.deathDate AS DeathDate

results.question: Which scholars won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1933?
results.answer:
]
The scholars who won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1933 were Paul A.M. Dirac and Erwin Schrödinger.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics' AND p.awardYear = 1933
RETURN s.knownName AS winner, p.category AS category, p.awardYear AS award_year
ORDER BY p.awardYear

results.question: Who are the female laureates in Physics?
results.answer:
]
The female laureates in Physics are Donna Strickland, who was awarded in 2018, Andrea Ghez, who received the award in 2020, Maria Goeppert Mayer, honored in 1963, and Marie Curie, recognized in 1903.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(s.gender) = 'female' AND toLower(p.category) = 'physics'
RETURN s.knownName AS female_laureate, p.category AS category, p.awardYear AS award_year

results.question: Which scholars born in France won a Nobel Prize in Chemistry?
results.answer: ]Scholars born in France who won a Nobel Prize in Chemistry are Jean-Pierre Sauvage, Fr\u00e9d\u00e9ric Joliot, Ir\u00e8ne Joliot-Curie, and Henri Moissan.
results.cypher:
MATCH (c:City)-[:IS_CITY_IN]->(co:Country)
WHERE toLower(co.name) STARTS WITH 'france'
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:BORN_IN]->(c)
MATCH (s)-[:WON]->(:Prize {category: "chemistry"})
RETURN s.knownName

results.question: Which Physics laureates were affiliated with an institution in Denmark?
results.answer:
]
The Physics laureates affiliated with an institution in Denmark are Aage N. Bohr, who was associated with the Niels Bohr Institute, and Ben R. Mottelson, who was linked to Nordita. Additionally, Niels Bohr himself, a prominent figure in physics, was affiliated with Copenhagen University in Denmark in 1922.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) WHERE toLower(p.category) CONTAINS 'physics'
MATCH (s)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution)-[:IS_LOCATED_IN]->(c:City)-[:IS_CITY_IN]->(co:Country) WHERE toLower(co.name) CONTAINS 'denmark'
RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName AS Scholarname, p.awardYear AS AwardYear, i.name AS InstitutionName

results.question: Which scholars affiliated with Stanford University won a prize in 1996?
results.answer:
]
Douglas D. Osheroff, a scholar affiliated with Stanford University, won a prize in 1996 in the field of physics.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution) WHERE toLower(i.name) CONTAINS 'stanford'
MATCH (s)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) WHERE p.awardYear = 1996
RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName, p.category, i.name AS Institution

]

]

WHERE toLower(i.name) = 'harvard university'
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'medicine'
RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName, p.awardYear

results.question: Who won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 2020?
results.answer:
]
Andrea Ghez won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 2020.
results.cypher: MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics' AND p.awardYear = 2020 RETURN s.knownName AS winner, p.awardYear AS award_year ORDER BY p.awardYear ASC LIMIT 1

results.question: Which scholars born in New York City won a Physics prize?
results.answer:
]
The following scholars born in New York City have won a Physics prize: Andrea Ghez (2020), Arthur Ashkin (2018), Carl D. Anderson (1936), Frank Wilczek (2004), H. David Politzer (2004), Julian Schwinger (1965), Leon M. Lederman (1988), Leon N. Cooper (1972), Martin L. Perl (1995), Melvin Schwartz (1988), Murray Gell-Mann (1969), Richard P. Feynman (1965), Robert Hofstadter (1961), Roy J. Glauber (2005), Russell A. Hulse (1993), Sheldon Glashow (1979), and Steven Weinberg (1979).
results.cypher: MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize) WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics' MATCH (s)-[:BORN_IN]->(c:City) WHERE toLower(c.name) CONTAINS 'new york' RETURN s.knownName, p.awardYear, c.name as BirthCity

ORDER BY p.awardYear

]

MATCH (s)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) CONTAINS 'physiology' OR toLower(p.category) CONTAINS 'medicine'
RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName, p.awardYear, i.name AS AffiliatedInstitution

results.question: Which scholars affiliated with CERN won a prize in Physics?
results.answer:
]
The scholars affiliated with CERN who won a prize in Physics are Carlo Rubbia, Simon van der Meer, Jack Steinberger, and Georges Charpak. Rubbia and van der Meer were jointly awarded in 1984, while Steinberger received his in 1988. Charpak was honored with his prize in 1992.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution)
WHERE toLower(i.name) CONTAINS 'cern'
MATCH (s)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics'
RETURN DISTINCT s.knownName, p.awardYear
ORDER BY p.awardYear

results.question: Which scholars born in Switzerland won the Physics prize between 1980 and 2020?
results.answer: No information found in the database.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:BORN_IN]->(c:City {name: toLower('switzerland')})
          -[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution)
          -[:IS_LOCATED_IN]->(c)
          -[:WON]->(p:Prize {category: toLower('physics'), awardYear: p.awardYear})
WHERE toLower(c.name) = 'switzerland' AND p.awardYear >= 1980 AND p.awardYear <= 2020
RETURN s.knownName AS scholar

results.question: How many female scholars won a Nobel Prize between 1980 and 2000?
results.answer:
]
No female scholars won a Nobel Prize in the field of chemistry between 1980 and 2000 according to the provided data.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'chemistry' AND toLower(s.gender) = 'female' AND p.awardYear >= 1980 AND p.awardYear <= 2000
RETURN count(s) as female_chemistry_laureates

results.question: Which scholars have won more than one Nobel Prize?
results.answer:
]
The scholars from the provided context who have won more than one Nobel Prize are Frederick Sanger, John Bardeen, Linus Pauling, and Marie Curie.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WITH s, count(p) AS prize_count
WHERE prize_count > 1
RETURN s.knownName
ORDER BY s.knownName

results.question: How many Physics laureates were born in Paris?
results.answer:
]
Three Physics laureates were born in Paris.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE toLower(p.category) = 'physics'
MATCH (s)-[:BORN_IN]->(c:City)
WHERE toLower(c.name) = 'paris'
RETURN count(s) as physics_laureate_count

results.question: How many scholars won a prize with a 1/3 share portion?
results.answer: Error executing graph query.
results.cypher:
MATCH (s:Scholar)-[:WON]->(p:Prize)
WHERE p.portion = "1/3"
WITH s
MATCH (s)-[:AFFILIATED_WITH]->(i:Institution)
RETURN s.knownName, COUNT(*) AS countOfScholarsWinning1ThirdPrize
ORDER BY countOfScholarsWinning1ThirdPrize DESC;
